item.title: QEMU: quick guide to a powerful virtualization tool
item.author: davcri91@gmail.com (Davide Cristini)
item.description: Sometimes you want to try a new operating system or particular software configuration, but you don’t want to touch your precious PC, risking to make your main production system unbootable. In these cases, software virtualization is your friend.

item.title: Four software projects I developed during college
item.author: davcri91@gmail.com (Davide Cristini)
item.description: During my time in Computer Engineering college in Italy, I developed various kind of software projects as an assignment for the courses.

item.title: About me
item.author: davcri91@gmail.com (Davide Cristini)
item.description: I’m Davide Cristini. I’m a software developer who loves to share thoughts about free and open source software, videogames and GNU\Linux OS. You can take a peek at my public projects and contributions on Github and Gitlab. Contact me I love talking to new people, feel free to contact me for anything! Email: davcri91@gmail.com Twitter: twitter.com/dav__cri I’m also on Google Plus but I don’t use it very often.
